Title: Disney's Cinderella Official US Trailer
Comment: A lot of people are hating on the remakes of movies, but I for one LOVE a good fairytale reboot. Now, I do prefer to have it with a modern spin, or a creative twist, different world etc, but there is something to be said for the classic stories. Plus, honestly there aren't new stories left to be told, not really, I once heard someone say that every story either begins with someone leaving town (moving, dying, disappearing, etc) or someone new moving in. The only thing left to do is tell it in a special way

Title: Disney's Cinderella Official US Trailer
Comment:
C'mon, guys. Give it a break. Yeah, Maleficent was a gigantic misfire but unlike that film, this one actually looks like they're keeping true to the story rather than butchering it for no reason.

I just want to point out that I personally felt Tim Burton's take on Alice in Wonderland was an enjoyable film. Not great but not bad. I know I'm not gonna make alot of friends by saying that but screw it, it's my opinion, dammit! You don't have to agree, just don't be a self-centered jerk about it.

Now admittedly the only thing I'm worried about the film is it's writer who previously co-wrote The Nutty Professor 2 and did the screenplay for The Golden Compass. You may now engage shivering with fear.

But this is director Kenneth Branagh for god's sake. He did one of the more well-known adaptations of Hamlet and successfully managed to bring Thor to the big screen properly.

Hopefully he knows what he's doing and maybe this could wipe off the bad taste of Maleficent and restore Disney's dignity. Not saying it could be good, I'm just saying maybe you could cut them a little slack.

There is talent behind this project so all we could do is wait and see.

Comment:
Few things to note to all the HATERS and DISLIKERS
1) Cinderella's mother is shown( Did Disney showed her dining the animated version?No!)
2) The fairy godmother would have a bigger role in this film
3) The stepmother has cinderella's freaking shoe!
4) Cinderella met the prince before the ball
5) The Grand Duke would have a more sinister role in this version
6)  This movie would be told by the Prince's point of view 
Out of this 6 notes how many of this â€œideas" have been put to other  Cinderella movies in the world? 0 to 1 and all of you are saying it's bland,unoriginal, sh*t,bad or any other things that are negative please think again.
*I'm a big fan of all things related to Cinderella...I loved the animated version....so I feel hurt when people criticise about this movie.

Title: Disney's Cinderella Official US Trailer
Comment: Honestly.... I don't see why the entire comparaison to the Disney movie... there are some references, yes... but the story is SO much more mature... That stupid animated movie didn't even had a real story. The mice were more protagonists than Cinderella herself. This movie seems much more respectful to the original Perrault story... And more importantly, I love the meaning that they give back to the story about kindness and courage. The kind of things everybody forgets about when it comes to fairy tales. And yes, Ever After is a good movie, but it lacks the magical aspects, which takes away the ambience and symbology of the tale. This looks promising...!

Title: Disney's Cinderella Official US Trailer
Comment:
To all those who will be complaining about another Cinderella film...

You definitely don't know how Hollywood works, do you? It's a big financial gamble if the studios were to invest in something new. If a producer or director were to approach the studios with an original story, then they, along with many other people, are at risk of losing their job. Why do you think a lot of studios are now taking the safe route by spawning out remakes and reboots? They know that people who are familiar with these stories will pay to see it. It's show business. Besides, there have been a large number of original films out there, but they're either unheard of, or they didn't do so well. Quit your complaining and stop falling into the category of a "whinger".
